speaker: Frasier
text: Where have you been?!  We're on in two minutes!

speaker: Roz
text: Forgive me, but I was busy preparing your schedule for tomorrow.  You've got lunch with the station manager, you're recording a PSA at three o'clock and don't forget to send flowers to your sister-in-law at the hospital.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, Maris's face-lift!

speaker: Roz
text: Really?  I didn't know she needed one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, she doesn't, actually.  There's nothing wrong with Maris that wouldn't be cured by a little sun, some exercise and a personality. _Roz laughs, then drops the rest of the papers in her hand into the wastebasket._

speaker: Frasier
text: What are those?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, just extra copies of your schedule.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why are you running down to the Xerox room for extra copies of my schedule?  It wouldn't have anything to do with that new intern, would it?  What's his name?

speaker: Roz
text: Eli.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, he's probably all of nineteen.

speaker: Roz
text: That's legal!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, coo-coo-ka-choo, Mrs. Robinson.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, the guy is so gorgeous, you just want to bite him all over, haven't you seen him?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I've been eating out lately!  You're not seriously thinking of dating him, are you?

speaker: Roz
text: Why is it all right for older men to date younger women but it's not okay for older women to date younger men?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't make the rules, Roz, I just enjoy them.

speaker: Roz
text: You're on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Seattle, this is Dr. Frasier Crane, KACL 780.  We're with you for the next three hours so let's get straight to it.  Roz, who's our first caller?

speaker: Roz
text: On line one we have Linda, she's calling from a car phone.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_presses button_] Hello, Linda, I'm listening.

speaker: Linda
text: [_v.o_] Oh, Dr. Crane.  My husband and I are right in the middle of a fight.  You see, we're on our way to the antique mart, we're obviously lost, but he refuses to stop and ask for directions.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, Linda, this is a common source of friction among couples. [_laughs_] Some men feel the need to be in control, they see asking for help as a sign of weakness.

speaker: Linda
text: Oh, everybody knows that.  Look, the reason I called is to ask how the hell do we get to the antique mart from Cherke Street and 14th Street.

speaker: Walter
text: [_v.o_] I don't need any directions!  I know where I am!

speaker: Linda
text: We're lost, Walter, face it, we're lost!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this isn't normally the kind of advice I give, but let me see, I've lived in Seattle most of my life.  Cherke and 14th, you would want to...

speaker: Roz
text: Dr. Crane, I've got a map right here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no thanks, Roz, I don't need any help! **QUICK!  GET MANILA ON THE PHONE**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is sat reading a book on the sofa and Daphne is playing patience on the table as Martin enters calling to Eddie off stage in the kitchen._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, put that down!  That's disgusting, why do animals always drag these things into the house?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God, what is it?  A rat?

speaker: Martin
text: No, it's a stupid doll!

speaker: Martin
text: He found it at the park and he carries it everywhere.

speaker: Martin
text: He never did this kind of stuff before you had him fixed!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought you'd be at the hospital with Maris.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm on my way down that now.  Poor Maris, she's so worried, she hasn't had much hospital experience.  Except the usual childhood things - you know, tonsils, adenoids, force-feeding.

speaker: Daphne
text: What's wrong with Mrs. Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it's nothing serious.  Cosmetic surgery.  Her chin, her lips, her cheeks, her eyelids...

speaker: Martin
text: Maybe it would be faster if you just told us what she's leaving alone!  You know, if you want my opinion, this is just vanity!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's not vanity, Dad, it's insecurity.  It's easy to understand how women can fall victim to our culture's worship at the altar of youth and beauty.

speaker: Niles
text: Precisely.  Women over forty can't help but feel unattractive if they don't have [_looking at Daphne_] perfect hair, porcelain skin...  limpid eyes...  pouting lips...  and the voluptuous contours of a goddess.

speaker: Niles
text: [_after a while_] I'm sorry, I forgot what my point was.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I know just what you mean, Dr. Crane.  I fell victim to that pressure myself once.  I had a mole removed.

speaker: Niles
text: Where?

speaker: Daphne
text: Just south of Manchester.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs at her innocence_] I meant where on your body?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_much less innocently_] So did I!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, what time is the surgery tomorrow?

speaker: Niles
text: First thing in the morning, which is why I'm here.  I know I'm being silly and I'm sure everything's going to be fine but I was wondering if I might have your moral support down at the hospital.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, sure, no problem.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  Well, I expect I'll be off.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles.  Not that it's any of my business but, er, how much is this whole thing setting you back?

speaker: Niles
text: Somewhere in the neighborhood of twenty-five thousand dollars.

speaker: Martin
text: Jeez, for an extra five grand you can get a whole new wife from the Philippines.  _Niles exits rolling his eyes.  FADE TO:_  **NO GUTS, NO GLORY**  _Scene Three - Hospital Waiting Room Frasier and Niles are sat in the waiting room as Dr. Sternstein wheels in a woman in her chair._

speaker: Sternstein
text: Ah, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Dr. Sternstein.

speaker: Sternstein
text: Excuse me for a moment.  Your wife is still in recovery but everything went splendidly so you can see her in a few minutes.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, doctor.

speaker: Sternstein
text: [_to patient_] All right, Mrs. Patterson.

speaker: Niles
text: Did you hear that, Frasier?  He said everything went fine. He's an incredible plastic surgeon.  Did you see that woman? Whoever Mr. Patterson is, he's a very lucky man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe that was Mr. Patterson!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, guess whose room I passed by on my way down the hall?  Artie Walsh.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad's old partner?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, apparently he was in for some tests last week and the results weren't very good.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh no, I always liked him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.

speaker: Niles
text: I still remember him inviting us to his house for weenie roasts when we were kids. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure he remembers you too, asking for a salad ni�oise!

speaker: Niles
text: Do you think Dad knows he's here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I doubt it.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you think he wants to know?

speaker: Frasier
text: Probably not.  They haven't spoken in years.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't suppose you got Artie to tell you what their big fight was all about?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, he's just as tight-lipped as Dad is.  Although, with a little arm twisting, I did get him to admit it was all Dad's fault!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you guys should really try the cafeteria here.  They've got a new chef - he's from Yemen.

speaker: Frasier
text: So many of the great ones are!

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, you know who's in the hospital here?  Artie Walsh. He's not at all well.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, one of the guys told me.  They might have to scoop out half of his intestines.  Here, taste this meatloaf, it's got just the right amount of chewiness. _Martin puts it under Niles' nose.  He is obviously turned off of the fact._

speaker: Niles
text: No, thank you. [_pause_] Are you gonna go see him?

speaker: Martin
text: No, can't think of any good reason why I should.

speaker: Frasier
text: Because he was your best friend for twenty years and now he's sick?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, he never came to see me when I took that bullet - when I was lying there with stuff flowing in and out of tubes and drains from every bodily opening. [_shows food to Niles_] At least taste this gravy!  [_Niles waves it off_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, we are talking about a few minutes out of your life! Just long enough to sit there and have a little chat with a very sick man.  I don't see why that's so impossible for you. Now, come on!  Believe me, you'll be glad you did.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, listen, sonny boy: that sanctimonious tone might wow 'em on the radio but it doesn't cut any ice with me!  When I say no, that's just what I mean.  I'm not sitting and chatting with Artie Walsh!

speaker: Frasier
text: Artie thought as much.

speaker: Martin
text: Why, what did he say?

speaker: Frasier
text: He said you wouldn't have the guts to go see him.

speaker: Martin
text: He said that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, then he snickered a little!

speaker: Martin
text: [_stands_] Well, I've got news for him.  I've got the guts. I've got twice the guts he has, and after his surgery tomorrow, I'll have four times the guts!  _Martin and Frasier exit down the hallway as Niles looks down at the meatloaf in his hands.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Artie's Hospital Room. Artie is lying in the bed as Frasier and Martin enter._

speaker: Frasier
text: Artie, it's me again.

speaker: Artie
text: [_notices Martin_] Martin?

speaker: Martin
text: Artie.

speaker: Frasier
text: When he knew you were in here, he insisted on rushing right over, didn't you, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well... they said you were in pretty rocky shape.

speaker: Artie
text: Well, they've been saying a lot of things.

speaker: Artie
text: Well, er, Marty, how's it been going?

speaker: Martin
text: Okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good.  Small steps.

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry you're laid up.

speaker: Artie
text: Thanks.  It was nice of you to come by.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess somebody had to be the big man.

speaker: Artie
text: [_laughs_] Yeah. [_realises_] What?  What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: Martin
text: I think you know what that means.

speaker: Artie
text: No, why don't you tell me what it means!

speaker: Martin
text: I mean I'm being a lot bigger than you were when I was in here!

speaker: Artie
text: You mean when you had that lousy bullet in your hip?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, that lousy bullet hurt, pal!

speaker: Artie
text: Not enough!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's too bad you never took a bullet, it might have improved you.

speaker: Artie
text: Just be glad you didn't take it in the butt - it could have caused brain damage!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you always have to have the last word, don't you!

speaker: Artie
text: Not with you, I don't want any words with you!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's too bad, because I've got a couple of real choice ones!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: Next time we'll stay longer. [_exits_]  _End of Act One  Act Two_  **ALBUQUERQUE IS APPROXIMATELY 136 SQUARE MILES**  _Scene One - Frasier's Apartment Frasier is sat on the sofa reading a magazine as Daphne helps Martin with his exercises on the floor.  Eddie is staring at Martin._

speaker: Martin
text: Stop staring at me like that, Eddie, I didn't touch your damn doll! [_pause_] Look, even if I did, you know, I did it for your own good.  You were becoming the joke of the park, even the poodles were laughing at you!  [_Eddie stares relentlessly_] Oh, all right!  Here.  _Martin reveals the doll from his chair and throws it down the hallway.  Eddie gallops after it and exits as Niles enters from the kitchen on his mobile phone.  Martin and Daphne finish their exercises and she helps him up into his chair._

speaker: Martin
text: I gotta get that dog a G.I. Joe!

speaker: Niles
text: [_on phone_] Yes, yes, Maris, I'm sure.  No, no, you can't gain weight from a glucose IV.  No, no, my little worry wart, there's no such thing as a NutraSweet drip.  Just, just try to close your eyes and go to sleep.  Goodnight, Puppy Toes. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Is everything okay with your wife?

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, no.  She can't get along with any of her nurses. Honestly, I'm at a loss to understand how a reputable hospital can hire nothing but troublemakers!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, the Little Sisters of Mercy have always had that reputation!

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I didn't get a chance to ask you, how did your reunion with Artie go?

speaker: Martin
text: [_sitting in chair_] Lousy.

speaker: Daphne
text: If you don't mind me asking; what started this bad blood between the two of you?

speaker: Martin
text: He spread a rumor about me through the department.

speaker: Frasier
text: About what?

speaker: Martin
text: None of your business.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I don't want to talk about it.  Subject closed.

speaker: Niles
text: Must have been pretty bad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.  Must have been on the take.

speaker: Daphne
text: More likely drugs.

speaker: Niles
text: Drugs, yes, drugs... Or sex.  Could be sex.

speaker: Frasier
text: Or all three!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right, it was worse than any of that. [_pause_] He told people... I cried at "Brian's Song."

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God!  You always think that's the kind of thing that happens to other people's fathers, not your own!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I wasn't crying!  Me and Artie were sitting at Duke's watching the movie and I got some pretzel salt in my eye! Artie thought it was the funniest thing in the world, the next thing I know he's telling everybody.  And then I become the joke of the department.  Other cops left Kleenex on my desk!  They called me "Boo Hoo Crane."

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I suppose I can understand your being upset with him. But, what's he so cheesed off with you for?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess I let something slip about the size of his wife's behind.

speaker: Daphne
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, she's got this gigantic rear end, I mean it's enormous. It looks like she's shoplifting throw pillows!

speaker: Frasier
text: And you felt compelled to share that with him?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, for twenty years I tried not to and then I guess one day I let my guard down.  We were both coming into the station house and he says, "Hi" and I say, "Hi" and he says, "How's the wife?" and I said, "At least she doesn't have an ass the size of Albuquerque!"

speaker: Niles
text: And that's it - a twenty-year relationship down the drain because of a little name calling!

speaker: Martin
text: No, there's more to it than that.  I mean, Artie always had to have the last word.  Always!  [_pause_] He couldn't leave well enough alone.

speaker: Martin
text: [_suddenly_] He couldn't let sleeping dogs lie.

speaker: Martin
text: [_suddenly_] You'd think it was all over and then he'd start saying something again.  Look, can we drop this?  Artie obviously still has an attitude and I've got better things to do than sit around a hospital room taking abuse. [_exits_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_realising_] Oh God, I'm due back with Maris.  Oh, if anyone needs me, I'll be sleeping at the hospital tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?

speaker: Niles
text: Maris's doctor feels it's more soothing for the patient to duplicate the home environment as closely as possible.  So I slipped a pearl-handed revolver under her pillow and got myself a room across the hall.

speaker: Frasier
text: I think we better say a little prayer for the night nurse!

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, it's such a shame your father and your friend just can't let bygones be bygones.  Especially at a time like this.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know what else to do, he's just so damn stubborn.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, maybe if I had a go at it.  You know, in the past year and a half I've come to have a pretty good understanding of how the Crane mind works - when it works!

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane, about your partner...

speaker: Martin
text: I don't want to talk about it anymore!

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, I just wanted to tell you I'm on your side.  After the way he treated you, I say good riddance to bad rubbish.

speaker: Martin
text: Damn right!

speaker: Daphne
text: It's hard to see how you could have had any good times together.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, there weren't many.  Well, occasionally we'd go fishing together.

speaker: Daphne
text: That doesn't sound like much fun.

speaker: Martin
text: [_reminiscing_] Well, not the way I did it.  But Artie got it into his head that he was going to teach me. [_laughs_] He even went out and bought this beaten old boat.  He always said after we retired we'd get more use out of it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, well, it seems awfully pushy of him to foist his interests on you.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it wasn't so bad.  I remember one time I bust my arm reeling in what turned out to be someone's old bedroom slipper.  You know what Artie did?  He just unhooked it and threw it right on the barbecue. [_laughs_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I guess maybe he wasn't such a bad guy after all.

speaker: Martin
text: [_pensive thought, then:_] You know, maybe you're right. I listen to myself talking and I sound like a big fool. Thanks Daphne, you really opened my eyes.

speaker: Daphne
text: I thought I might.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I'm going to march right down to that hospital, buy him a big stuffed animal and then throws my arms around him and never, ever let him go! [_blows a raspberry in her face_]

speaker: Daphne
text: You really are a hateful old sod, aren't you?

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, Eddie, time for your walk!  _Martin goes to the door with Eddie as the phone rings. Frasier answers it._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Yes, it is. [_pause, then in morbid tones_] Oh, I see. Yes, well, I guess it isn't really a shock, considering. Yes, I'm sure they did everything they could.  Thank you. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Martin
text: What was that?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_quietly_] We'll talk about it later, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: [_worried_] Is everything okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: Why do you ask?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't know.  You saying, "I'm sorry" and stuff like "I'm sure you did everything you could" and it's natural to be concerned.

speaker: Frasier
text: You thought that call was about Artie, didn't you?

speaker: Martin
text: No!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you did!

speaker: Martin
text: So what if I did?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it just proves my point - you still care about him!

speaker: Martin
text: All right, so suppose I do care about him, suppose I do feel bad about this stupid fight and want it over.  What the hell can I do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's up to you.  But if you like, I could drive you down to the hospital.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sends Eddie away and puts down lead_] I don't need you to lead me.  I can drive myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, you can't.

speaker: Martin
text: Why not?

speaker: Frasier
text: That was your mechanic, your transmission's dead.  _Martin glares, while Daphne smiles.  Martin and Frasier exit.  FADE TO:_  **WELL, WE'VE COME THIS FAR WITHOUT A BEDPAN JOKE...**  _Scene Two - Artie's Hospital Room Artie is in bed watching the television.  It is on loud as Frasier and Martin enter._

speaker: Frasier
text: Artie?

speaker: Artie
text: Oh, Jeez...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, now look.  You guys got off on the wrong foot...

speaker: Martin
text: All right, Frasier, I'll handle this. [_comes in_] Artie... [_pause, uncomfortable_] Will you turn the TV off?

speaker: Artie
text: I'll turn it down.

speaker: Martin
text: Listen, Artie, I'm sorry about some of those things I said earlier on, okay?  Maybe all of them.  I guess I was still a little steamed that you never came to see me in the hospital.

speaker: Artie
text: I didn't come by because...  well, I just didn't think you'd want to see me.

speaker: Martin
text: Of course I wanted to see you!

speaker: Artie
text: [_smiles_] That's what my wife said.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, Loretta. _Martin shows Frasier the picture.  Frasier looks -- and his eyes nearly pop out of his skull.  As Martin replaces the picture, Frasier shifts his own behind in the air, trying to imagine how somebody could be that circumferencially blessed._

speaker: Artie
text: Anyway, I'm glad you could come by.  And I know it's not easy. Especially for someone as stubborn as you are.

speaker: Martin
text: Me stubborn?!  Hey, listen pal, I'm not the one who always has to have the last...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you're right, Artie.  I am stubborn.  And it wasn't easy.

speaker: Artie
text: Thanks, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Frasier_] Listen, Artie and I have a couple of things to talk about so, if you, er, if you'll just wait outside, it'll be a lot easier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, fine, Dad.  Anything I can say right now would just be irrelevant.  One thing you learn as a therapist is once things are working well between people, anything else you can say would just be... _Martin motions him to leave.  Frasier exits.  Martin pulls up a chair next to Artie's bed._

speaker: Martin
text: So, what's a rotten old cop like you doing in a joint like this?

speaker: Artie
text: Believe me, it wasn't my idea.  This is not how I expected things to end.

speaker: Martin
text: What are you talking about, end?  You're going to be out on the street raising hell before you know it.

speaker: Artie
text: I don't know, Marty.  The doctors aren't exactly tossing their hats up in the air over this one.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, my sons are doctors, they don't know nothing!  Now, listen, you're going to get yourself out of here, okay? Cause we've got a lot of lost time to make up for.  Hey, do you still have that stupid boat?

speaker: Artie
text: Oh, yeah. [_chuckles_] I hung on to it.

speaker: Martin
text: Good, we'll sink that damn thing yet!  Hey, Artie, do you remember that time you barbecued the bedroom slipper? [_laughs_]

speaker: Artie
text: I kept telling you, stuff always tastes better when you catch it yourself. [_laughs_] _As the two laugh, Frasier sits outside in the hallway.  Niles arrives in the hallway bearing an armful of gifts.  He notices his brother._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.  What are you doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I finally got Dad and Artie Walsh talking again.  Of course I did have to resort to cheap, manipulative pseudo- psychology.

speaker: Niles
text: Always go to your strengths.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what about you?  It looks like you've bought out the entire gift shop.  Maris should be pleased.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, this isn't for Maris, it's for her nurses.  They're having a meeting right now to discuss her care and from what people tell me - a hospital strike can be ugly!

speaker: Nurse
text: Visiting hours are over, gentlemen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you, I'll go round up dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Er, excuse me, do you work on my wife's floor - Mrs. Maris Crane?

speaker: Nurse
text: [_immediately standoffish_] Yes, I do.

speaker: Niles
text: I'd like you to have these chocolates. [_hands them over_]

speaker: Nurse
text: I'm on the night shift.

speaker: Niles
text: And this lovely watch. [_hands it over_]  _The nurse exits, satisfied.  In Artie's room, Martin and Artie are laughing again as Frasier interrupts._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, dad?  It's time to go.

speaker: Artie
text: What?  You get another phone call about your dad's transmission?  [_they laugh_] Your dad told me about that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all I was doing was...

speaker: Artie
text: Yeah, yeah, I know what you were doing. [_winks_] Thanks, kid.

speaker: Frasier
text: See you soon.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, now, we've got a deal, all right?  As soon as you get sprung from this joint, you've got to give me some serious fishing lessons.

speaker: Artie
text: IF I get out.

speaker: Martin
text: WHEN you get out!  You're not getting the last word on this one!

speaker: Artie
text: See you, Marty.

speaker: Martin
text: [_stands_] See you, Art.

speaker: Artie
text: Bye.

speaker: Martin
text: Bye.

speaker: Artie
text: Take care.

speaker: Martin
text: Take care.

speaker: Artie
text: Stay loose! _Martin opens the door and nearly exits.  However just before he closes the door:_

speaker: Martin
text: See you, Artie! _Martin quickly slams the door stopping him from having the last word.  Martin laughs as he walks with Frasier down the hallway.  Halfway down the hall, he stops and walks back the door.  He opens it._

speaker: Artie
text: [_o.s_] See you, Marty.
